interesting_fact: India is the world's largest democracy and home to the world's second-largest population.
Japan has the world's oldest continuously operating company, founded in 578 AD.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world's lakes combined.
The Amazon rainforest, mostly in Brazil, produces about 20% of the world's oxygen.
Australia is home to more kangaroos than humans.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 11% of Earth's landmass.
China is home to the Great Wall, the longest wall in the world, stretching over 21,000 kilometers.
Iceland has no mosquitoes, thanks to its unique climate and geography.
Egypt is home to the oldest known pyramid, the Pyramid of Djoser, built in the 27th century BC.
Switzerland is one of the few countries with no official capital city declared in its constitution.
